org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.internal.Core

Class HardwareMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.internal.Core.HardwareMapper

  • public final class HardwareMapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to manage hardware mapping. It holds methods used to map components.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HardwareMapper(RobotBase myRobot)
      Constructor- assigns robot to passed in robot

    • Method Detail

      • mapMotor

        public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor mapMotor(java.lang.String NAME,
                                                        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple.Direction DIRECTION)
        Attempts to map a motor with the provided name. Result is returned, allowing an assignment operator (=) to map the desired motor. Sends a log error message if failed.
        Parameters:
        NAME - Name of the DcMotor as it appears in the configuration file
        Returns:
        Returns a DcMotor, mapped if succeeded, null if failed

      • mapMRGyro

        public com.qualcomm.hardware.modernrobotics.ModernRoboticsI2cGyro mapMRGyro(java.lang.String NAME,
                                                                            com.qualcomm.hardware.modernrobotics.ModernRoboticsI2cGyro.HeadingMode mode)
        Attempts to map a Modern Robotics Integrating Gyroscope. Also attempts to set its heading mode to cartesian. Result is returned, allowing an assignment operator to map the desired gyro. Sends a log error message if failed.
        Parameters:
        NAME - Name of the Gyro as it appears in the configuration file
        Returns:
        Returns a gyro, mapped if succeeded, null if failed

      • mapMRRange

        public com.qualcomm.hardware.modernrobotics.ModernRoboticsI2cRangeSensor mapMRRange(java.lang.String NAME)
        Attempts to map a Modern Robotics Range sensor. Result is returned, allowing an assignment operator to map the desired range sensor. Sends a log error message if failed.
        Parameters:
        NAME - Name of the Range sensor as it appears in the configuration file
        Returns:
        Returns a range sensor, mapped if succeeded, null if failed
